page.title: 09WESTWOODSIDE'S HERITAGE SOC.
page.content: The{Heritage Society}is made up of a group of people, who are interested in the past history of the parish. Westwoodside, Haxey, Eastlound, Graizelound and Low Burnham are the places included in the area. The{Society}holds over 500 photographs of the past, and copies of wills. They also have a collection of documents, deeds, newspaper cuttings, maps, transcripts of the parish register from 1558 and an inventory of family trees. People in the village have lent them to the {Society. Meetings are held every month on the second Thursday, at 7.30p.m. in Haxey Memorial Hall. Activites include outings to museums, talks by old villagers and courses on how to discover things about the past.
